Tech@SG aims to help fast-growing companies access the critical talent they need to grow and scale their business in Singapore and the region. The programme is jointly administered by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and Enterprise Singapore.
Key Features

For eligible companies, the Tech@SG Programme provides company-level endorsement to the Ministry of Manpower (MOM), reducing the risks of rejections for their Employment Pass (EP) applications to MOM.
If your company is eligible, you can expect to receive:
Up to 10 new EPs over two years for foreign employees who will be hired as part of your company’s core team in Singapore; and thereafter,
Coverage for the first renewal of each new EP obtained under the programme (each renewal will be valid for up to three years)
Tech@SG aims to help fast-growing companies access talent to grow their business in Singapore.
Eligible companies get endorsement to the Ministry of Manpower for their Employment Pass applications.

As the world’s best bank, DBS innovates to deliver a new kind of banking for our global clients that is simple, seamless and invisible. We serve over 12.2 million clients globally in 19 markets, in a broad range of industries and sectors. As the Safest Bank in Asia, DBS is constantly rated as “AA-“ and “Aa1” by S&P and Moody’s. We center around your needs, position ourselves as a dedicated and one-stop service, facilitating to either build up regional operations or deepen their presence in ASEAN countries. DBS provides comprehensive access to the best solutions, tailored for you by our team of experts, including Corporate Banking solutions, Capital Market solutions, and Wealth Management. We also facilitate your business and provide such full bandwidth capability within our six core markets, including: Singapore, China, Hong Kong SAR, Taiwan Region, India, and Indonesia.
As the world’s best bank, DBS innovates to deliver a new kind of banking for our global clients that is simple, seamless and invisible. Sign up for a workshop to learn more about seamless banking.

Our team of experienced professionals stays at the forefront of industry trends and developments, ensuring that our clients have access to the latest information and strategies for success, growing their businesses. Many of our clients have told us, “I feel relieved and at ease when I consult Pasona. Thank you.” These testimonials are what makes us feel the significance of our presence in the Singapore market.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: [Workshop] Going Global: Using Singapore as your talent launchpad from Japan to the world (シンガポール人事労務入門編 )

content.text: In going global, many companies are finding it increasingly difficult to manage their global human resource operations amid a more diverse range of career and workplace needs. The need to engage in open and constructive communication with every employee is becoming more prevalent than ever. As they say, “What you do is important, but who you work with and what kind of environment you work in, is just as, if not more crucial.” If you are a Japanese company that wants to effectively expand your parent group’s operations and culture to access Southeast Asia’s fast-growing markets, join this session to learn more about how Singapore can be your talent launchpad to the world. Tap into Pasona’s industry insights for Japanese companies and discover how to accelerate your human resource and talent management strategy.

name: A*STAR Singapore Institute of Food and Biotechnology Innovation

Overview.Title: A*STAR Institute of Food and Biotechnology Innovation (SIFBI)

content.text: SIFBI is a research institute that focuses in driving innovation for food, nutrition and well-being in the region. The institute supports Singapore’s food resilience and sustainability through the creation of proprietary knowledge from lab to scale up. SIFBI covers a wide range of areas including discovery and sustainable biomanufacturing of value-added ingredients for food and consumer care through strain engineering and biotransformation, analytics, food process engineering, nutrition and sensory science.

CardDetails.CardHeader: A*STAR Institute of Food and Biotechnology Innovation (SIFBI)

content.text: SIFBI offers capabilities across biotechnology, nutrition, food process engineering and analytics. Collaborate with SIFBI to undertake research in alternative foods and the circular bioeconomy.

Capabilities.Title: Request to connect with A*STAR SIFBI

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Scale up with Fermentation Joint Lab at Food Tech Innovation Centre (FTIC)

content.text: Designed for supporting R&D from lab to scale up, the food-grade fermentation lab supports up to 100L fermentation and offers scale-up bioprocess design to create sustainable value-added ingredients e.g. alternative lipids and protein. It provides downstream processing expertise and equipment e.g. spray-drying and cross-flow filtration systems to optimize extraction, separation, and recovery.

This is coupled with analytical services and High-Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC) machine to support testing of a broad spectrum of bio-based products. This facility is built to support food tech startups in product development and scale-up efforts, streamlining the path from concept to market.
International and local food tech start-ups, SMEs, MNCs, Institutes of Higher Learning and universities

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Scale up with Food Processing Joint Lab at Food Tech Innovation Centre (FTIC)

content.text: This joint lab offers advanced pilot-scale facilities e.g. High Moisture Extrusion (HME), up to 100kg/hr, and High Pressure Processing (HPP) with up to 6,000 bars with adjustable hold times, and temperature for food tech start-ups to tap on when creating textures in hybrid or plant-based alternative protein products. Along with our expertise in protein texturisation and prototype development, we can accelerate innovation and translation efforts at the pilot scale while optimizing processes and organoleptic properties.
Start-ups, emerging food tech companies, SMEs, MNCs, institutes of higher learnings and universities

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. Discovery and development of value-added ingredient

content.text: Leveraging on our Natural Product Library with 100,000+ IP-free strains from 100+ countries, companies can partner with our Discovery and Analytics teams to screen and identify bioactive and alternative producers. Our Strain Engineering and Biotransformation teams specializes in designing cell factories, engineer metabolic pathways, and optimizing growth to sustainably produce high-value compounds like bioactive, lipids, and proteins through fermentation for the food and consumer care industries, supporting from lab to scale-up. Additionally, we also explore the use of sidestream as an alternative feedstock.

Our flavours and aroma team can assist companies in identifying flavour and aroma produced during processing e.g. cooking and fermentation, and re-engineer flavour solutions. Through matching the sensorial quality of target food products, the team offers innovative and sustainable ingredient options for the food industry.
Food and Beverage Companies, Nutraceutical and Functional Food Companies, Biotechnology Startups, Pharmaceutical Companies, Ingredient Supply Companies

The Bioprocessing Technology Institute (BTI) is a national research institute under A*STAR with core expertise in bioprocess science and engineering. Established in 1990 as the Bioprocessing Technology Unit, it was renamed the Bioprocessing Technology Institute (BTI) in 2003.
BTI has integrated capabilities to accelerate innovation in biologics, cell and gene therapy, and nucleic acid therapeutics manufacturing.
The Bioprocessing Technology Institute (BTI) is a national research institute under A*STAR with core expertise in bioprocess science and engineering. Connect with BTI for research collaborations.

Capabilities.Title: Request to connect with A*STAR BTI

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Research collaboration on biomanufacturing process development

content.text: BTI has capabilities in process development, including continuous biomanufacturing and mechanistic modelling for bioprocess development, supported by multi-omic process characterisation competencies. BTI is keen to collaborate with industry partners to co-develop innovative technologies for various protein, cell and nucleic acid applications.
Biotech companies that are ready to develop processes for scale-up in protein biologic drugs, cell and gene therapies, and nucleic acid therapies

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Research collaboration on analytical quality control for bioprocessing

content.text: BTI has capabilities in multi-omic process characterisation, QA/QC and method development, supported by mechanistic modelling competencies. BTI is keen to collaborate with industry partners to co-develop innovative technologies for various protein, cell and nucleic acid applications.
Biotech companies that are ready to develop QA/QC methods for protein biologic drugs, cell and gene therapies, and nucleic acid therapies

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. Research collaboration on biologic asset, media and cell line development

content.text: BTI has capabilities in antibody design, media formulation and cell line development, supported by multi-omic process characterisation and scalable process development competencies. BTI is keen to collaborate with industry partners to co-develop innovative technologies for various protein, cell and nucleic acid applications.
Biotech companies that are ready to conduct media and cell line optimisation for protein biologic drugs, cell and gene therapies, and nucleic acid therapies

EDDC is Singapore’s national platform for drug discovery and development. With a focus on Asian-prevalent diseases, we champion the translation of great science into great medicines to galvanise the growth of Singapore’s biopharma ecosystem. We have built a robust network of partners, collaborators and stakeholders that span across Singapore and the world. From academia to industry, we seek out collaborative ventures to help nurture the local biotech scene and advance our portfolio assets.
Connect with EDDC, Singapore’s national platform for drug discovery and development. With a focus on Asian-prevalent diseases, they champion the translation of great science into great medicines.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Collaborations for co-development of company’s assets

content.text: We welcome industry partners with complementary resources, expertise or projects to explore collaboration or co-development opportunities with us.
We are keen to partner with biotechs, pharma companies and venture funds to support or jointly accelerate the development of therapeutic assets in flexible, shared-risk-shared rewards model.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Licensing or collaborations around EDDC’s assets (small and large molecules) and platforms

content.text: EDDC’s pipeline consists of projects at various stages of development in both small and large molecule modalities. Our pipeline projects are focused on the following indications: Oncology, Immunology and Inflammation, Infectious diseases and Ophthalmology. We are also focusing on small molecule RNA-targeting approaches, intrinsic degraders and leveraging AI in drug discovery.
We are keen to partner with biotechs, pharma companies and venture funds to license, support or jointly accelerate the development of therapeutic assets.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. Fee-for-service access to EDDC’s drug discovery & development expertise and technology platforms (EARO)

content.text: EARO facilitates drug discovery research by offering flexible service modes, with main focus on high-throughput screening, high-throughput phenomics and compound library services. Clients can choose:
EARO-Access (Access to equipment and user training)
EARO-Assist (Project consultation/assistance with equipment access)
EARO-Comprehensive (End-to-end service provision)
We have worked with and welcome enquiries from public-sector research organisations, biotechs, pharmas/MNCs which can benefit from our suite of capabilities and cutting-edge technologies.

The Land Intensification Allowance (LIA) is a tax allowance for companies that incur qualifying capital expenditure on enhancing industrial land productivity towards more land-efficient and higher value-added activities.
The LIA is available to businesses in industry sectors that have large land takes and low Gross Plot Ratios (GPR), namely, the manufacturing and logistics sectors.
The LIA is administered by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Building and Construction Authority (BCA).
Companies looking to intensify industrial land use towards more land-efficient and higher value-added activities may apply for the LIA.

Gallant Venture Ltd. ("GV"), headquartered and listed in Singapore, is an Indonesia focused investment holding company with operations primarily in the islands of Batam and Bintan, Indonesia. Our business is well-positioned to leverage on the strategic alliance between Singapore and Indonesia governments and close proximity to Singapore. The principal business of GV and its subsidiaries ("the Group") are utilities provider, master planner and developer of industrial parks, property development and resort operations. Through the Group's associated companies' PT Indomobil Sukses International Tbk ("PT IMAS") and BOMC Pte Ltd ("BOMC"), the Group has foothold in the automotive and offshore marine industry.

name: [The Workshop] SIG Tax & Accounting Pte Ltd

content.text: SIG TAX & ACCOUNTING PTE LTD, a professional accounting and tax firm based in Singapore, specializes in delivering a wide array of financial and tax-related services to local and international businesses. These services encompass tax planning, preparation of financial statements, audit support, and an array of other accounting and tax-related assistance. Furthermore, the company serves as a vital platform for global enterprises seeking to invest in Singapore, offering expert advisory and consulting services regarding cross-border investments and business expansion.

SIG TAX & ACCOUNTING PTE LTD established in 2009 and has consistently expanded its client base and service portfolio, solidifying its position as a reputable entity in Singapore's accounting and tax sector. This growth can be attributed to its unwavering commitment to providing top-notch financial and tax services and acting as a guide for international enterprises seeking opportunities in the Singaporean market.

Working with SIG TAX & ACCOUNTING PTE LTD offers a distinct advantage due to our unwavering commitment to excellence and comprehensive expertise in the realms of accounting and tax services. Our firm prides itself on delivering high-quality, tailored financial solutions to both local and international clients. We stand out as a reputable partner by virtue of our extensive experience, which spans over a decade, and our continuous dedication to staying updated with the ever-evolving financial landscape in Singapore.

We offer a diverse range of services, from meticulous financial statement preparation and strategic tax planning to reliable audit support, catering to the distinct needs of each client. Moreover, our role as a gateway for international enterprises eyeing Singapore as an investment destination allows us to provide invaluable guidance and consultancy services for seamless cross-border expansions. Choosing to collaborate with us ensures not just professional assistance, but a trusted partnership founded on expertise, reliability, and a commitment to achieving the best financial outcomes for your business.

SIG TAX & ACCOUNTING PTE LTD, a professional accounting and tax firm based in Singapore, specializes in delivering a wide array of financial and tax-related services to local and international businesses.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: [Workshop] Secrets of Success: Navigating incorporation, wealth management, visas, taxes and certification in Singapore

content.text: Are you grappling with the complexities of launching your business in Singapore? Join SIG Tax & Accounting's Workshop to set up for success from Singapore. SIG Tax & Accounting is a professional accounting and tax firm specialising in tax planning, financial statement preparation, audit support, advisory and consulting services for cross-border investments and business expansion. 'Secrets of Success' will introduce you to Singapore's business environment, covering attractive policies and schemes provided by the Singapore government, how to seamlessly incorporate your business, manage your wealth, and secure the permits and certifications you need to expand in Asia. Additionally, you will discover the various passes available for entrepreneurs, expatriates, and their families. Your journey towards business success in Southeast Asia, from Singapore starts here!

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: [Workshop] Introducing Singapore's Business Ecosystem

content.text: Singapore: Your gateway to the world’s fastest growing region. The vast potential for business growth in Emerging Asia cannot be ignored. The region is characterized by favorable demographics, a robust consumer base, rapid urbanization, digital transformation, and technological advancements, and is an untapped treasure trove for ambitious entrepreneurs. Successfully expanding a business into a new region can seem like a daunting task. Yes, there may be complexities, but with strategic planning and a trusted local partner, you’ll turn challenges into lucrative opportunities.
Join Acclime's exclusive workshop as we unravel the immense potential of Singapore as your gateway to the rest of the ASEAN region.
Our workshop will delve into the following:
-Why Singapore
-Typologies of business structures
-Intricacies of work passes, immigration regulations, taxations frameworks and tax incentives available for business in Singapore.
-Practical dos and don’ts when investing into the region through Singapore.

This workshop will be facilitated by Acclime, Asia’s fastest growing corporate service provider. Our seasoned team of experts situated in Singapore and across the key ASEAN markets are at your disposal to discuss any queries regarding local incorporation procedures, company secretarial matters, accounting and taxation requirements, data protection guidelines, and many more topics.

Overview.Title: Singapore Polytechnic Consumer Chemicals Technology Centre (CCTC)

content.text: Consumer Chemicals Technology Centre (CCTC) was setup in late 2019 with the aim of providing an ‘end-to-end consumer business ecosystem’ of service offerings with its strategic partners, to support industry within the beauty and personal care space with
their innovation and business transformation needs. More specifically, CCTC helps companies develop customized personal care formulations that can meet the needs of their target market.

CCTC was established as a Centre of Innovation for Beauty and Personal Care (COI BPC) in August 2022 by Enterprise Singapore to be the engagement point for industry to drive innovation in Singapore’s beauty and personal care landscape. This establishment sharpened CCTC’s focus in offering specialised technical expertise towards areas of clean beauty, green cosmetics and creating innovative and sustainable formulations development and solutions. In addition, CCTC also provides a comprehensive range of services designed to support businesses in their development of new consumer care products, such as process optimization, product evaluation and ensuring compliance with regulations in target markets. By leveraging these services, companies can successfully bring their products to both local and global markets, achieving commercial success.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Singapore Polytechnic Consumer Chemicals Technology Centre (CCTC)

content.text: Consumer Chemicals Technology Centre (CCTC) was setup in late 2019 with the aim of providing an ‘end-to-end business ecosystem’ of service offerings with its strategic partners, to support industry within the beauty and personal care space with
their innovation and business transformation needs.

Capabilities.Title: Request to connect with SP CCTC

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Co-develop Innovative and Customised Beauty and Personal Care Products and Services

content.text: As a COI BPC, CCTC supports the development of innovative and sustainable consumer care products for companies in the beauty and personal care sector based on their unique product requirements to meet target market needs.

CCTC offers specialised technical expertise and a comprehensive range of services for formulation development, including process optimisation, product evaluation, storage stability, microbiological safety testing, and sensory evaluation.
This is open to all beauty and personal care companies seeking to develop innovation solutions and meet evolving and growing consumer needs in the beauty industry.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Skills & Technology Adoption Readiness (STAR) for (i) Formulation Science of Cosmetics (ii) Compounding and Fragrance Evaluation: Project-based Training

content.text: This customised project-based training course leverages CCTC's expertise and capabilities in the ideation and creation of personal care formulations and bespoke fragrances. Through hands-on learning and co-development of fragrances or formulations alongside trainers, participants will be equipped with the necessary knowledge and technical skills in fragrance and cosmetic formulation science.
Start-Ups and SMEs interested in building staff capabilities to co-develop innovative cosmetic and fragrance formulations.

The Pioneer Industries (Manufacturing) “PC(M)” encourages companies to carry out desirable manufacturing activities in Singapore on a significant scale that generate tangible economic spin-offs.
Companies looking to grow capabilities and conduct desirable manufacturing activities on a significant scale may apply for the Pioneer Industries (Manufacturing) “PC(M)”.

name: Development and Expansion Incentive for Manufacturing

content.text: The Development and Expansion Incentive for Manufacturing “DEI(Mfg)” encourages companies to engage in high value-added manufacturing activities in Singapore, either through a new setup or an expansion of existing operations in Singapore.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Development and Expansion Incentive for Manufacturing [DEI(Mfg)]

content.text: Companies looking to engage in high value-added manufacturing activities in Singapore may apply for the DEI(Mfg).

The International Headquarters Award (IHQ) encourages companies to set up or expand their global or regional headquarters activities of managing, coordinating and controlling business activities for a group of companies, in Singapore.
Companies looking to set up or expand their global or regional headquarters activities in Singapore may apply for the IHQ Award.

name: Development and Expansion Incentive for Services

content.text: The Development and Expansion Incentive for Services “DEI(Svc)” encourages companies to engage in high value-added services or activities in Singapore, either through a new setup or an expansion of existing operations in Singapore.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Development and Expansion Incentive for Services [DEI(Svc)]

content.text: Companies looking to engage in high value-added services or activities in Singapore may apply for the DEI(Svc).
The IP Development Incentive (IDI) aims to encourage the use and commercialisation of intellectual property rights arising from research and development (R&D) activities.
Companies looking to use and commercialise intellectual property rights arising from research and development in Singapore may apply for the IDI.

The Finance and Treasury Centre (FTC) Incentive aims to encourage companies to grow treasury management capabilities and use Singapore as a base for conducting strategic finance and treasury management activities.
Companies looking to grow treasury management capabilities and conduct strategic finance and treasury management activities from Singapore may apply for the FTC Incentive.

name: Aircraft Leasing Scheme and Aircraft Investment Manager Incentive

content.text: The Aircraft Leasing Scheme (ALS) and Aircraft Investment Manager (AIM) Incentive aim to encourage companies to develop aircraft leasing capabilities and grow the aircraft leasing industry in Singapore.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Aircraft Leasing Scheme (ALS) and Aircraft Investment Manager (AIM) Incentive

content.text: Companies looking to develop aircraft leasing capabilities and grow the aircraft leasing industry in Singapore may apply for the ALS and AIM Incentive.

The Resource Efficiency Grant for Emissions (REG(E)) aims to provide enhanced support to manufacturing facilities and data centres to undertake projects that improve their energy efficiency and other forms of eligible emissions reduction, to sustain competitiveness in a low-carbon future.
Companies looking to improve their energy efficiency and reduce emissions for their manufacturing facilities or data centres may apply for the REG(E).

The Land Intensification Allowance (LIA) is a tax allowance for companies that incur qualifying capital expenditure on enhancing industrial land productivity towards more land-efficient and higher value-added activities.
The LIA is available to businesses in industry sectors that have large land takes and low Gross Plot Ratios (GPR), namely, the manufacturing and logistics sectors.
The LIA is administered by the Singapore Economic Development Board (EDB) and the Building and Construction Authority (BCA).
Companies looking to intensify industrial land use towards more land-efficient and higher value-added activities may apply for the LIA.

SCRI is the national coordinating body for clinical trials (CT) and serves as the point of contact for CT enquiries and information in Singapore. SCRI is responsible for enhancing the local CT ecosystem, identifying and addressing gaps and weaknesses, and monitoring progress and benchmarking Singapore’s CT performance. SCRI also supports the conduct of investigator-initiated trials and industry-sponsored trials in Singapore through its Academic Research Organisation unit.
SCRI is the national coordinating body for clinical trials (CT) and serves as the point of contact for CT enquiries and information in Singapore. Connect with them for clinical studies and networks.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. SCRI Academic Research Organisation (ARO)

content.text: As Singapore's only academic clinical research organisation, SCRI ARO collaborates with academics, specializing in Investigator Initiated Trials (IITs). Adhering to ICH-GCP regulations, it provides a cost-effective solution for institutions lacking resources. SCRI's expertise spans Phase 1 to 4 clinical trials, offering proficiency in project management, data services, and biostatistics. The Data Management team excels in Electronic Data Capture (EDC), enhancing data processes. Research Informatics provides tech support, adopting new technologies. With experienced Project Management and Monitoring teams, SCRI ensures efficient trial execution, data integrity, and subject safety, propelling advancements in medical research.

SCRI ARO caters to a diverse audience, including academic researchers and investigators planning clinical studies. Ideal for institutions lacking in-house resources, SCRI specializes in Investigator Initiated Trials (IITs) and ensures adherence to ICH-GCP regulations. It serves professionals and entities requiring expertise in all clinical trials phases. Collaborators seeking proficiency in Electronic Data Capture (EDC) and innovative research informatics find ARO support beneficial.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. SCRI Academy

content.text: SCRI Academy is Singapore’s pivotal learning and development platform for Clinical Research Coordinators (CRCs). Funded by the Ministry of Health, it undertakes the crucial task of cultivating a proficient talent pool of CRCs to reinforce Singapore's status as a hub for clinical trials. This is accomplished through tailored programs for CRCs at diverse experience levels. SCRI Academy also offers workshops in other disciplines of clinical trials including epidemiology, HEOR, biostatistics and clinical drug development.  Additionally, SCRI Academy endeavours to heighten public awareness of clinical research, emphasising the pivotal role of clinical trials in elevating Singapore’s clinical landscape.

Individual CRCs seeking professional growth or organisations looking to train their staff in CRC work.  SCRI Academy is also regularly engaged by public and private entities to conduct general clinical research and trials courses for their employees. Companies/organisations outside of Singapore may also engage SCRI Academy to translate our comprehensive CRC curriculum to another language to facilitate training CRCs in their company/country.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. SCRI Clinical Research Networks (CRN)

content.text: Clinical Research Networks (CRN) are critical platforms to gather clinical evidence that was not possible in the past with single sites. SCRI’s development of networks in the Asia-Pacific region provides engagement opportunities in critically important and relevant research for diseases of Asian significance and/or prevalence. Our regional networks facilitate and enhance collaborative partnerships between academia, industry and governments, and consist of cadres of clinical key opinion leaders in a multitude of Asia-Pacific countries with research interests in particular disease areas. SCRI further supports these networks with clinical trial operational capabilities, allowing potential trial sponsors to access different Asian populations through engagement with regional clinical experts through a single point of contact.

Companies and organisations seeking to test their drug or device in different Asian populations.  These trial sponsors will be connected to networks of experienced clinical researchers with good trial experience and access to ideal patient populations.

STCC, a national cancer consortium, operates as a cohesive initiative aimed at meeting the demand for a synergised, nationwide cancer research and translation platform. This consortium brings together Singapore's cancer research landscape, proactively initiating and executing collaborative cancer programs. Moreover, it fosters partnerships between institutions and industries, driving the progress of cancer treatment and patient care forward.
STCC, a national cancer consortium, aims to meeting demand for a synergised, nationwide cancer research and translation platform. Connect with them for research and clinical trial opportunities.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Impactful and innovative early phase oncology clinical trials, and increasing access to treatments for cancer patients

content.text: The Cancer Clinical Trials and Investigational Medicine Units platform aims to drive impactful and innovative clinical research and elevate Singapore’s position as a leading destination for conducting cancer clinical trials. We offer unique solutions to support and streamline clinical trial conduct by bringing together the expertise, capabilities, and resources across the three healthcare clusters in Singapore. STCC partners with research and pharmaceutical/ biotechnology organisations in both the public sector and industry with the common goal of facilitating access to innovative treatments for cancer patients.
Pharmaceuticals and Biotech with therapeutic pipelines.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. A national resource of cancer samples matched with clinical data, enabling for mutually beneficial collaborations that would translate into novel discoveries that advances healthcare improvements.

content.text: STCC’s cancer database and tissue banks combines existing databases of the SingHealth, National University Health System Tissue Repositories (NUHS TR) and Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH), and is aligned with the Singapore Network of Biorepositories (SINB), which catalogues specimens and data of other disease types. This will serve as a common national-level resource platform that supports investigators’ queries by providing access to different data including specimen type, clinically annotated data, and Omics data.
Pharmaceuticals and Biotech actively engaged in clinical research and therapeutic discoveries.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. Oncology translational and pre-clinical research

content.text: STCC creates and delivers end-to-end solutions that supports multi-institutional translational and pre-clinical studies, from study design to outcomes. We bring together expertise from cancer research institutes and academic centres across Singapore, with the common goal of developing, testing and validating potential new biomarkers and molecular diagnostics. Our platform boasts a comprehensive facilitation pipeline for translational and pre-clinical research, and functions as a coordinating hub for molecular assays and ex vivo tumour models. This supports our mission to promote collaboration and cohesiveness among academia and industry players in the cancer research community.
Pharmaceuticals and Biotech actively engaged in clinical research and therapeutic discoveries.

The first educational institution in Singapore to leverage the Problem-based Learning approach for all its diploma programmes, Republic Polytechnic (RP) has seven schools and one academic centre offering 37 full-time diplomas in Applied Science, Engineering, Management and Communication, Hospitality, Infocomm, Sports, Health and Leisure, and Technology for the Arts.

RP is committed to nurturing professionals with strong problem-solving capabilities through an innovative and entrepreneurial learning environment, based on a holistic and industry-relevant curriculum. RP's Academy for Continuing Education also offers a comprehensive suite of lifelong learning programmes to provide adult learners with skills upgrading opportunities.

RP is the only polytechnic in Singapore to have dedicated schools for hospitality and sports. Its domain expertise also extends to supply chain management and urban agriculture, among others. Many RP lecturers and staff in innovation centres have industry experience prior to joining RP and continue to collaborate closely with industry through consultancy and applied research projects. They also work with industry to facilitate knowledge sharing through staff attachments and training, and help industry meet their talent needs through internships and job opportunities.
Republic Polytechnic is well-known for its domain expertise in supply chain management and urban agriculture. Connect with RP's Centres of Innovation to learn about their innovation technologies.

Capabilities.Title: Request to connect with Republic Polytechnic

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Co-develop Innovative Products and Services

content.text: Republic Polytechnic is well-known for its domain expertise in supply chain management and urban agriculture. Besides its

two Centres of Innovation focusing on Supply Chain Management and Urban Agriculture, RP has a total of 17 technology development centres (collectively referred to as Conexus Centres) that offer expertise across a wide range of industry sectors and technologies in areas such as chemicals and materials innovation, smart engineering, artificial intelligence, internet of things and consumer insights.

Managed by a team of highly committed staff with strong Research and Development (R&D) and industry experience, RP is poised to create tailored solutions that align with business requirements. Companies are welcome to partner RP to address innovation challenges and requirements, and leverage RP’s expertise and capabilities to develop solutions based on business needs.
Centre of Innovation for Supply Chain Management (COI-SCM):
COI-SCM helps Singapore-based companies strengthen and develop supply chain and logistics expertise and improve performance through process innovation and innovative use of technology.
Urban Agriculture Centre of Innovation (UACOI)

UACOI aims to drive Research and Development (R&D) and innovation partnerships across the urban agriculture value chain. It also supports the build-up of innovation capabilities for small and medium-sized enterprises in this sector.
Open to all companies seeking support to develop innovative solutions and build staff capabilities.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Learn with us

content.text: Republic Polytechnic’s Academy for Continuing Education (ACE) has a strong emphasis on continuous training and talent development within organisations to address the challenges of the ever-changing business landscape. The Centre provides customised solutions to meet business objectives through its wide range of courses.
The robust nature of RP’s programmes guarantees that learners receive timely, highly relevant, and comprehensive education that is aligned with their learning requirements.
Customised Training Programmes
Team-building Programme
Training with Project Implementation
Project Mentorship Support
Design Thinking and Ideation Workshops
Workplace Learning/ On the Job (OTJ) Blueprint Development

The National Centre of Excellence for Workplace Learning @ Republic Polytechnic (NACE@RP) is focused on helping businesses make workplace learning a part of their business. Workplace Learning allows employees to upskill or reskill within their work environment, thus enabling companies to respond more effectively in a fast-changing environment. By inculcating a progressive and sustainable learning culture, businesses can benefit from increased productivity and innovation, thus enabling the business to grow and thrive.
NACE@RP helps companies design, develop and implement Workplace Learning through training and consultancy projects.
Open to all companies interested in staff learning and development offerings

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. Hire our students

content.text: The RP internship programme is designed to give our RP students a first-hand experience of the work environment and allow them to apply knowledge, skill sets, use and techniques gained from the classroom. This programme is only possible with strong support from industry partners. The duration for the RP internship programme ranges from 20 to 24 weeks, depending on the diploma. Companies can:
Gain access to a pool of prospective employees and talents
Develop students' potential for possible full-time employment after graduation
Receive skilled support for digitalisation, improvement or innovation projects.

RP’s SkillsFuture Work-Study Certificate and Work-Study Post-Diploma aim to enable companies to meet their manpower needs and retain their talent. The programme works by deepening the skills and knowledge of ITE and Polytechnic graduates in the fields they have studied in school. It is designed in collaboration with industry to ensure relevance of skills.
Participating companies can recruit suitable fresh local graduates who then undergo structured on-the-job training and mentorship within the companies.

RP's Work-Study Programme is designed in collaboration with the industry to ensure employee's relevancy while meeting employer's manpower need. Suitable candidates will be job-matched based on their field of studies and undergo structured on-the-job training and mentorship in your company.
Companies can also contact us to share job opportunities or explore short-term work attachments with our students.
Open to companies keen to collaborate with RP on internships and offer employment opportunities for our students and graduates.

IMDA Open Innovation Platform helps corporates crowdsource innovation solutions from a global network of over 13,000 tech solution providers. OIP provides structured, high-touch innovation support - from diagnosing businesses' challenges to refining the problem statement, assessing proposals and setting key performance indicators to ensure the right outcomes. To-date, we have facilitated over 300 challenges, with more than SGD$13 million in prize money and support.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Infocomm Media Development Authority of Singapore (IMDA), Open Innovation Platform

content.text: IMDA Open Innovation Platform helps corporates crowdsource innovation solutions from a global network of over 13,000 tech solution providers.

Capabilities.Title: Request to connect with IMDA Open Innovation Platform

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Accelerating Innovation and Market Entry

content.text: IMDA Open Innovation Platform (OIP) connects businesses with a global network of over 13,000 tech solution providers, facilitating crowd sourcing of innovative solutions. The platform offers comprehensive, high-touch support throughout the innovation journey, from identifying business challenges and refining problem statements to evaluating proposal and setting clear KPIs for success outcomes.
Corporates who are looking to overcome business challenges through innovative solutions to their internal problems or seeking to develop new products and services
Corporates who may have limited R&D resources, who wish to access a wider pool of talent and expertise without significant upfront costs.
Corporates who are looking to speed up the innovation cycles (ideation, prototyping and testing processes) and bring innovative solutions to market faster.

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Increased Efficiency and Cost Savings

content.text: Businesses can tap on IMDA's Discovery Engine, a self-help portal that allows users to streamline their search for qualified and validated tech solvers. By eliminating the need to screen numerous potential providers, users can quickly identify ideal solutions aligned with their specific needs. Intuitive filters like Sectors, Technology Area and Location further simplify the search process, ensuring businesses find the perfect match for their unique challenges. Explore the Discovery Engine Self-Help Portal
here
Corporates who are looking to speed up the innovation cycles (ideation, prototyping and testing processes) and bring innovative solutions to market faster.

name: Infocomm Media Development Authority of Singapore (IMDA)

Overview.Title: Infocomm Media Development Authority of Singapore (IMDA), Accreditation and Spark Programmes

content.text: The IMDA drives Singapore's digital transformation with infocomm media (ICM) to create a dynamic, holistic and exciting ecosystem filled with growth opportunities through talent, research, innovation and enterprise.
A key contributor to Singapore's digital transformation and the Digital Economy strategy, the
IMDA Accreditation

programme has a vital role in growing and nurturing the local ICM technology ecosystem. It aims to accelerate the growth of innovative Singapore-based enterprise tech product companies by establishing their credentials and positioning them as qualified contenders to government and large enterprise buyers. This opens up opportunities for their solutions to be showcased and adopted globally.
The
IMDA Spark

programme aims to address the key challenges and support the growth of promising Singapore-based ICM startups through a hybrid of Government grant tools and the creation of a vibrant, collaborative ecosystem and network. This provides opportunities for promising enterprise tech start-ups to pitch and build initial reference customers in Singapore.

Overview.Title: Health Sciences Authority Innovation Office (HSA IO)

content.text: The HSA IO facilitates the efficient development and timely registration of beneficial innovative therapeutic products (chemical and biologic compounds) and cell, tissue or gene therapy products (CTGTPs) in Singapore. It provides scientific and regulatory support to facilitate the translation of scientific discoveries into clinical treatments that are beneficial to patients in Singapore.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Health Sciences Authority, Innovation Office (HSA IO)

content.text: The HSA IO facilitates the efficient development and timely registration of beneficial innovative therapeutic products (chemical and biologic compounds) and cell, tissue or gene thearpy products (CTGTPs) in Singapore.

Capabilities.Title: Request to connect with HSA IO

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: Seek early advice on therapeutic product and cell, tissue or gene therapy product development

content.text: Engage with the HSA IO on regulatory requirements, and seek early guidance on technical or scientific issues that need to be considered during product development. These include:
Non-clinical development
Clinical development
Quality development, such as Chemistry, Manufacturing and Controls (CMC)
Manufacturing and Good Manufacturing Practice (GMP)
Regulatory submissions
By clicking "Work with HSA IO", you will be redirected to HSA IO's website. As this connection request is not facilitated by EDB Nav, it is subjected to HSA IO's own service protocols and policies.
Researchers, academia, biotechs, and pharmaceutical companies with an interest in early-stage clinical product development, and with the intent to pursue product regulation in Singapore

name: Advanced Cell Therapy and Research Institute, Singapore

Overview.Title: Advanced Cell Therapy and Research Institute, Singapore (ACTRIS)

content.text: The Advanced Cell Therapy and Research Institute, Singapore (ACTRIS) was established in 2020 to be the national and regional centre of excellence for facilitating discovery, process development and manufacturing of cellular-based therapeutics. Its objectives are to promote and foster the entire value chain of the cellular therapy ecosystem through enabling translational research and development, manufacturing, clinical service provision and commercialisation by serving the healthcare, academic and industrial sectors. ACTRIS also provides value-added services such as workforce training, regulatory facilitation and ancillary material standardisation pertaining to delivery of cellular therapy to patients.

CardDetails.CardHeader: Advanced Cell Therapy and Research Institute, Singapore (ACTRIS)

content.text: The Advanced Cell Therapy and Research Institute, Singapore (ACTRIS) was established in 2020 to be the national and regional centre of excellence for facilitating discovery, process development and manufacturing of cellular-based therapeutics.

CardMetadataTwo: Advanced Cell Therapy and Research Institute, Singapore (ACTRIS)

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 1. Technology Transfer

content.text: ACTRIS will perform all the manufacturing related activities and the client is just expected to source for project specific equipment and reagents. A key advantage of this model for clients is that through the service provisions and capabilities of ACTRIS, the novel or in-house CTGTPs will have an expedited route to clinical trials and potential commercialisation and/or clinical adoption.
Academic Institutions

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 2. Facility Rental

content.text: The client will perform all key activities - such as bringing in necessary project-specific equipment and manpower to perform all other aspects of manufacturing, while ACTRIS provides the GMP rooms with basic equipment and training for the clients' employees to use the facility. A key advantage of this model for pharmaceutical companies is that it will allow them to initiate manufacturing activities on a small-scale through ACTRIS as they embark on developing their own commercial-scale facility within Singapore.
Pharmaceutical companies

AccordionItems.AccordionItemTitle: 3. Partnership

content.text: ACTRIS will provide GMP rooms and manpower training while the client will have to source for project specific equipment and reagents. A key advantage of this model for start-up/ biotechnology companies is that early investments will be used for product development to expedite clinical manufacturing and product pipeline expansion rather than channeling investment towards infrastructure building and operationalisation. Only after the novel CTGT products by these biotechnology companies have proven to be safe and efficacious in early phase trials will it then be de-risked and be more suited to be manufactured at an "owned" or outsourced commercial-scale facility to support multicentre trials or large-scale distribution network.
Start-up and biotechnology companies

OverviewSection.SectionTitle: Singapore: The World's Leading Manufacturing Hub

content.text: Barely 730km

in size, Singapore embarked on a bold policy shift towards export-led industrialisation in 1965, overcoming limitations in land, natural resources and talent to grow its manufacturing sector. Today, manufacturing is a key economic pillar of growth for Singapore and contributes about 20 per cent of the country’s annual gross domestic product (GDP). This is significantly higher than other developed nations, such as Japan and Germany, where manufacturing’s share of national G
DP is below 10 per cent.

Singapore is a global leader in sectors like aerospace, semiconductors and biomedical sciences, and is one of the best places to digitalise and automate factory processes, allowing manufacturers to optimise their value chain for higher productivity and yield with ease.

OverviewSection.Header: Driving Global Impact with a World Class Manufacturing Ecosystem

content.text: With Singapore’s nationwide focus on adopting i4.0, global manufacturers based in the city-state can better navigate transformations in the industry by accessing and developing cutting-edge technologies for their manufacturing strategies.

Manufacturers can readily connect with industry players, whether multinational corporations (MNCs) or small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), to develop new capabilities and achieve world-class operations.
Singapore remains at the forefront of innovation for advanced manufacturing as the most innovative country in Asia-Pacific, with local institutions like NTU, SUTD, A*STAR globally
ranked amongst the top for
semiconductor and biotechnology research.
As th
e 2nd most attractive destination in the world for global talent, and with a highly-skilled and adaptable w
orkforce, Singapore offers the manufacturing sector a robust talent pool.
We know that setting up in a new country comes with unique challenges. But Singapore is here to make it straightforward for you.

Great talent is critical for business growth. If you’re thinking of expanding your operations in Singapore and Southeast Asia, there is a clear business case to develop corporate leaders from Singapore’s highly-educated and multilingual workforce, who can navigate the region’s diverse operating environments.

The Singapore government is committed to helping you nurture your local talents so they can take on corporate leadership roles. This guide pulls together the various leadership training schemes and offerings available so you can easily find one that suits the needs of your business and talent pool. Read on to learn about the application process, eligibility, and benefits of each programme.
For questions on the programmes, please reach out to the respective administrators directly. For feedback on this guide, please contact the EDB Nav team.
For participating employers who are prefer to hire mid-career individuals and provide training for their new job role.
For participating employers who prefer to train prospective mid-career candidates through training and work attachments before hiring, working in partnership with industry partners.
Only for employers undergoing business transformation, where  existing workers are at risk of redundancy or in vulnerable jobs due to the transformation.

The Singapore Business Leaders Programme (SBLP) is Asia’s premier senior business leaders’ programme.

Since its first run in May 2011, the SBLP has featured an illustrious list of speakers such as the Presidents and CEOs of global and regional companies, renowned thought leaders, academic leaders, as well as political leaders.
HR practitioners who are preparing to move into regional or global HR leadership roles.
Participants will gain exposure to global thought leaders, C-suite business leaders, and policy makers who will share insights and experiences on drivers for success at the CHRO level.

The programme includes a blended learning journey that encompasses both face-to-face meetings and virtual sessions. Participants will be immersed in experiential learning opportunities while developing pillars of support with a network of peers from a cross-section of industries and organisations.
Senior HR leaders with 15-20 years of collective experience in business and/or HR roles

The Singapore Business Leaders Programme (SBLP) is Asia’s premier senior business leaders’ programme.

Since its first run in May 2011, the SBLP has featured an illustrious list of speakers such as the Presidents and CEOs of global and regional companies, renowned thought leaders, academic leaders, as well as political leaders.
Senior business executives and entrepreneurs based anywhere in the world who have an interest in Asia​​.

In addition to top academic and political leaders, SBLP brings together illustrious business speakers who share practical advice for the challenges that participants face. The SBLP brings in the insights, knowledge, and network of Asia, enabling participants to understand leadership through an Asian lens. Through SBLP, participants are better equipped to lead and succeed in Asia and the world.

Participants get to join a 4.5 day residential programme with a small and exclusive cohort of senior business leaders. Each cohort size is kept small to facilitate open and honest conversations among peers. SBLP participants graduate to become part of a larger HCLI network of alumni comprising senior leaders across industries.
Typical applicants include C-suite leaders, direct reports of CEOs, and business owners of mid-to-large size companies.
The programme fee of SGD 25,000* per participant (subject to GST) includes:
Course materials
Daily refreshments and meals
Hosted dinners during the programme
Accommodation during the programme dates (4 nights’ stay, inclusive of daily breakfast)

OverviewSection.SectionTitle: How can CCPs support my company's manpower needs?

content.text: Career Conversion Programmes (CCPs) help companies meet their manpower needs by providing support for them to reskill mid-career workers for in-demand growth jobs.
Growth jobs roles are emerging or good job opportunities with long-term prospects for progression, identified in each sector in response to how the industry is expected to transform over time. Today,
Workforce Singapore (WSG) offers close to 100 CCPs across around 30 sectors.
Find out more
here

OverviewSection.Header: Types of CCPs and target audience

content.text: Companies keen to expand their local hiring pipeline through the
hiring and training of mid-career individuals
to take on new growth job roles.
Companies interested in acting as
host employers
to provide jobseekers with
training and work attachments
, in growth job roles where there are good prospects for placement.
Companies keen to reskill
existing employees
to take on new or redesigned job roles that are aligned with Industry Transformation Maps/
Jobs Transformation Maps
Up to 90% salary support to reskill mid-career individuals into in-demand growth jobs.
Industry-recognised training to reskill mid-career individuals for in-demand growth jobs.
Reskilling support across around 30 sectors.
Place-and-Train / Job Redesign (JR) Reskiling
Participating company must be registered or incorporated in Singapore.

Must be able to offer a full-time employment contract on permanent terms or on contract terms that are no less than one (1) year, directly related to the job which the CCP is for, with remuneration that is commensurate with the market rate.
Must commit to the CCP training arrangements for the mid-career individuals that they have selected for the conversion programme.
Must be committed to work with WSG or its appointed partner/s on programme administrative requirements.
Attach-and-Train
Hosting organisations must be registered or incorporated in Singapore.
Must offer full-time attachment positions directly relevant to identified Attach-and-Train CCP job occupations.
Must commit to Attach-and-Train CCP training arrangements.
Must be committed to work with WSG or its appointed partner/s on programme administrative requirements.

GuideStepperItems.Title: Identify a CCP relevant to your needs.

content.text: Browse the
CCP Portal

GuideStepperItems.Title: Reach out to the Programme Partner (PP) contact listed.

content.text: PP will respond in 1-2 weeks’ time to request for more information.

GuideStepperItems.Title: Prepare application, including hiring projections, draft on-the-job training (OJT) plans, and information on candidates to undergo CCP training.

content.text: PP will assess application and issue Letter of Offer upon approval.

GuideStepperItems.Title: Upon acceptance of Letter of Offer, upload approved CCP candidate information.

GuideStepperItemLink.Label: Upload information on the Application Management System.

GuideStepperItems.Title: Commence training for CCP candidates.
Update PP on training progress.
Submit claims to PP upon completion of the CCP training.
Receive grant from PP upon claim approval from WSG.

content.text: The Career Conversion Programmes (CCPs) by Workforce Singapore (WSG) provide financial support to companies
in reskilling mid-career individuals to take on new job roles with good longer term prospects and opportunities.
CCPs
by Workforce Singapore
offer financial support to companies to reskill employees to take on new job roles. Read more for a step-by-step guide on how companies can leverage and apply for CCPs.

Great talent is critical for business growth. If you’re thinking of expanding your operations in Singapore and Southeast Asia, there is a clear business case to develop corporate leaders from Singapore’s highly-educated and multilingual workforce, who can navigate the region’s diverse operating environments.

The Singapore government is committed to helping you nurture your local talents so they can take on corporate leadership roles. This guide pulls together the various leadership training programmes and offerings available so you can easily find one that suits the needs of your business and talent pool. Read on to learn about the application process, eligibility, and benefits of each programme.

We understand that companies differ across industries, business cycles, and in terms of their ability to talent ahead of needs. Therefore there are three models of career conversion programmes to enable comp
For participating employers who are prefer to hire mid-career individuals and provide training for their new job role.
For participating employers who prefer to train prospective mid-career candidates through training and work attachments before hiring, working in partnership with industry partners.
Only for employers undergoing business transformation, where  existing workers are at risk of redundancy or in vulnerable jobs due to the transformation.

Since its first run in May 2011, the SBLP has featured an illustrious list of speakers such as the Presidents and CEOs of global and regional companies, renowned thought leaders, academic leaders, as well as political leaders.
HR practitioners who are preparing to move into regional or global HR leadership roles.
Participants will gain exposure to global thought leaders, C-suite business leaders, and policy makers who will share insights and experiences on drivers for success at the CHRO level.

The programme includes a blended learning journey that encompasses both face-to-face meetings and virtual sessions. Participants will be immersed in experiential learning opportunities while developing pillars of support with a network of peers from a cross-section of industries and organisations.
Senior HR leaders with 15-20 years of collective experience in business and/or HR roles
Programme dates*:
3-26 April 2024 (Run 14)
4-27 September 2024 (Run 15)
*6 days over 1 month
The programme fee of SGD 9,600** per participant (subject to GST) includes:
Course materials
Daily coffee breaks and lunch
